DOC.brief_summary: The objective study test Fasting-Mimicking Diet ( FMD ) efficacy improve immune response flu vaccination older adult population ( 50-75 year age ) .
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize clinical trial test safety efficacy fasting-mimicking diet ( FMD ) elderly population ( 50-75 year age ) receive annual influenza vaccination . The study include two arm : Control ( normal diet ) FMD ( 2 cycle 5-day fasting-mimicking diet within two month ) . Participants arm receive standard influenza vaccine.The primary endpoint anti-influenza antibody titer measure 4 week flu vaccination . Secondary endpoint include : ( 1 ) body composition change , measure BMI , waist hip ratio ; ( 2 ) physiological change , measure blood chemistry motor performance ; ( 3 ) health outcome , measure SF-36 Health survey , dry eye survey flu incident within 12 month vaccination .
DOC.criteria: Ability willingness provide write informed consent ; Ability willingness undergo 2 cycle 5day dietary regimen ; Ability willingness provide blood sample via venipuncture ; Seeking get seasonal influenza vaccine . Concomitant medication Received flu ( influenza ) shot flu season ; Receiving immunosuppressive therapy ( i.e. , oral prednisone dose > 10 mg daily ) ; On immunosuppressive drug cancer rheumatologic therapy ; Receiving insulin octreotide ; On hypertension medication . The subject must obtain treat doctor 's approval prior begin study . Safetybased exclusion : Hemoglobin < 9.0 g/dL ; White blood cell count < 3,500/mm^3 ; Neutrophil count < 2,000/mm^3 , Platelet count < 125,000/mm^3 ; Medical condition incompatible dietary intervention ; Medical condition incompatible flu vaccination ; Pregnant nursing female ; Alcohol dependency ;
